snippet: The Obama administration announced Friday that it would extend the deadline for states to submit their plans for health insurance exchanges.
abstract: Obama administration, with many states lagging far behind schedule, says it will extend deadline for them to submit plans for health insurance exchanges, online markets where millions of Americans are expected to obtain private coverage subsidized by federal government.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration announced Friday that it would extend the deadline for states to submit their plans for health insurance exchanges.

headline.seo: U.S. Extends Deadline on Health Coverage for States
headline.main: U.S. Extends a Deadline for States on Coverage
headline.print_headline: U.S. Extends A Deadline For States On Coverage

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
